title: 103_s1345
content:
The Equity in Educational Land Grant Status Act of 1993 is defined in Section 1. Section 2 provides definitions. The term "Institute" in this Act refers to the Institute of American Indian and Alaska Native Culture and Arts Development established under section 1504 of the American Indian, Alaska Native, and Native Hawaiian Culture and Arts Development Act. It also includes tribally controlled community colleges. Development Act (20 U.S.C. 4411) defines tribally controlled community colleges as per Section 2(a)(4) of the Tribally Controlled Community College Assistance Act of 1978 (25 U.S.C. 1801(a)(4)). These colleges offer post-secondary vocational education. The term "tribally controlled post-secondary vocational institutions" is defined in Section 390(2) of the Tribally Controlled Vocational Institutions Support Act of 1990 (20 U.S.C. 2397h). Tribally controlled community colleges and post-secondary vocational institutions have SEC. 3 land grant status. Tribally controlled community colleges and post-secondary vocational institutions, such as the Institute, Southwest Indian Polytechnic Institute, and Haskell Indian Junior College, are considered land-grant colleges established for the benefit of agriculture and the mechanical arts according to the provisions of the Act of July 2, 1862. In accordance with the provisions of the Act of July 2, 1862, as amended, the applicability of related provisions states that any provision of any Act of Congress relating to the operation of, or provision of, assistance to a land-grant college in the United States, Puerto Rico, the District of Columbia, the Virgin Islands, Guam, American Samoa, or the Northern. The provisions of the Act of July 2, 1862, as amended, apply to land-grant colleges and institutions in various states and territories, with authorization for appropriations. Appropriations are authorized for tribal colleges and institutions described in subsection (a) of the Act of July 2, 1862, as amended, relating to donations of public land or land script for the endowment and maintenance of colleges for the benefit of agriculture and the mechanic arts, with an appropriation of $10,000,000. Amounts appropriated pursuant to this section shall be held and considered granted to tribal colleges and institutions subject to the provisions of that Act applicable to the proceeds from the sale of land or land script. The Act titled "Equity in Educational Land-Grant Status Act of 1993" defines the term "Equity in Educational Land-Grant Status Act of 1993". The term "1994 Institutions" in the Act refers to specific colleges including Bay Mills Community College, Blackfeet Community College, Cheyenne River Community College, D-Q University, Dullknife Memorial College, Fond Du Lac Community College, Fort Belknap Community College, Fort Berthold Community College, Fort Peck Community College, LacCourte Orielles Ojibwa Community College, Little Big Horn Community College, Little Hoop Community College, and Nebraska Indian Community College. LAND-GRANT STATUS FOR 1994 INSTITUTIONS. 1994 Institutions are considered land-grant colleges established for agriculture and mechanic arts in accordance with the Act of July 2, 1862. Provisions of Acts of Congress related to land-grant colleges in various regions apply to 1994 Institutions. The provision regarding the application of certain Acts of Congress to United States territories and exceptions for agricultural research at eligible colleges is outlined. Authorization of $23,000,000 to 1994 Institutions for endowment and maintenance, replacing provisions of the Act of July 2, 1862 related to donations of public land. The funds granted to 1994 Institutions are subject to the provisions of the Act applicable to proceeds from land sales or land scrip. SEC. 4. APPROPRIATIONS. The Act of August 30, 1890 is amended to include $50,000 funding for 1994 Institutions. The Act of August 30, 1890 is amended to provide funding for 1994 Institutions, with specific instructions on how the funds should be allocated and managed. The Act of May 8, 1914 (38 Stat. 373, chapter 79; 7 U.S.C. 343) is amended to authorize appropriations for 1994 Institutions, with $5,000,000 allocated for the fiscal year ending June 30, 1995, and each fiscal year thereafter. These funds are in addition to those appropriated for other states and territories under this section. The Act of May 8, 1914 is amended to authorize appropriations for 1994 Institutions in Puerto Rico, the Virgin Islands, and Guam. Funds will be distributed through a competitive applications process and administered by State institutions in cooperation with 1994 Institutions. The Act of May 8, 1914 is amended to authorize appropriations for 1994 Institutions in Puerto Rico, the Virgin Islands, and Guam. Funds will be distributed through a competitive applications process and administered by State institutions in cooperation with 1994 Institutions. There shall be no matching requirement for funds made available pursuant to subsection (b)(3). The Act of May 8, 1914 is amended to authorize appropriations for 1994 Institutions in Puerto Rico, the Virgin Islands, and Guam. Funds will be distributed through a competitive applications process and administered by State institutions in cooperation with 1994 Institutions. There shall be no matching requirement for funds made available pursuant to subsection (b)(3). SEC. 5. RESEARCH FACILITIES. The Research Facilities Act is amended to assist 1994 Institutions in constructing, acquiring, and remodeling buildings and facilities for agricultural research from 1995 to 1999. The Research Facilities Act is amended to provide $1,700,000 annually from 1995 to 1999 for grants to 1994 Institutions for constructing, acquiring, and remodeling buildings and facilities for agricultural research. Amend the title to read: "A bill to provide land-grant status for certain Indian colleges and institutions."
